=== Jaunty Release Parties ===
Ubuntu California is hosting a number of events for the <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/JauntyReleaseSchedule|release]]</nowiki> of Jaunty (which is April 23).  Events are taking place <nowiki>[[JauntyReleaseParties|world wide]]</nowiki>.

=== Events ===

==== Party in San Francisco ====
** <nowiki>[[https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/ubuntu-us-ca/2009-April/000527.html|Event summary]]</nowiki>
** Date: Thursday, April 23, 2009
** Time: 8 til late
** Event URLs:
** http://modernhacker.com/jaunty/
** http://upcoming.yahoo.com/event/2463176
** Location: Caffeine, 835 Geary, San Francisco, CA
** Location URL: http://www.yelp.com/biz/caffeine-san-francisco
** Notes: Please contact Jesse Zbikowski or <nowiki>[[Grantbow]]</nowiki> for details

==== Party(Lunch) in Santa Monica ====
* Date: Thursday, April 23, 2009
* 12:00 - 1:30 p.m.
* Location: 3rd Street Promenade and Santa Monica Blvd, Santa Monica, CA
* See instructions for normal, weekly <nowiki>[[http://thursdaylunch.com/|ThursdayLunch]]</nowiki> meetup.  We will also celebrate the Jaunty Release this week.
* Thirteen attended, <nowiki>[[http://farm4.static.flickr.com/3478/3469549812_1dd45e0699_o.jpg|Nine pictured]]</nowiki>.

==== Party in Walnut Creek ====
** <nowiki>[[https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/ubuntu-us-ca/2009-May/000555.html|Event summary]]</nowiki>
** Date: Friday, April 24, 2009
** Time: 7 pm - 9 pm
** Location: Caffe La Scala, 1655 N Main St, Walnut Creek, CA
** Location URL: http://www.yelp.com/biz/caffe-la-scala-walnut-creek
** Notes: Informal, Free WIFI, contact <nowiki>[[Grantbow]]</nowiki> for details

==== Party in Orange/LA/Anaheim/etc ====
* Date: Saturday,  April 25, 2009
* Location: Pei Wei in Lake Forest (<nowiki>[[http://maps.google.com/maps?f=q&source=s_q&hl=en&geocode=&q=23632+El+Toro+Rd&sll=33.619194,-117.70267&sspn=0.024015,0.038624&ie=UTF8&ll=33.622767,-117.696877&spn=0.096057,0.154495&z=13&iwloc=A|23632 El Toro Road, Lake Forest]]</nowiki>)
* 7pm (until we're done!) -- They close at 10
* Location URL: http://www.peiwei.com/
* Notes: Food is tasty! (<nowiki>[[http://www.peiwei.com/pdfs/menus/finalmenuc.pdf|menu]]</nowiki>)

==== Party in Felton (Santa Cruz) ====
* Date: Saturday, May 2, 2009
* Location: Felton LUG meeting, Felton Fire Station, 135 Kirby St., Felton
* 2-5 p.m.
* Details to follow. Contact <nowiki>[[Lcafiero]]</nowiki> or call 831-335-7303 for details.

==== General Release Information ====
{{http://www.ubuntu.com/files/countdown/904/countdown-9.04-1/00.png|Jaunty/9.04 is here!|align="right"}}
* For general Ubuntu information please see <nowiki>[[http://www.ubuntu.com|www.ubuntu.com]]</nowiki> or ask in one of Ubuntu's <nowiki>[[http://www.ubuntu.com/support/communitysupport|community support areas]]</nowiki>.
* Ubuntu "Jaunty" 9.04 was <nowiki>[[https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/ubuntu-announce/2009-April/000122.html|announced]]</nowiki> April 23, 2009. Jaunty <nowiki>[[http://www.ubuntu.com/getubuntu/releasenotes/904|Release notes]]</nowiki> contain important information and should be read before <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/JauntyUpgrades|upgrading]]</nowiki> or <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Installation|installing]]</nowiki>.
* The Canonical press releases on the <nowiki>[[http://www.ubuntu.com/news/ubuntu-9.04-desktop|desktop]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://www.ubuntu.com/news/ubuntu-9.04-unr|netbook]]</nowiki> & <nowiki>[[http://www.ubuntu.com/news/ubuntu-9.04-server|server]]</nowiki> versions have helpful Jaunty overviews.  For higher level descriptions, the Canonical <nowiki>[[http://www.ubuntu.com/products/whatisubuntu/904features/|Tour of new features]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[JauntyJackalope-TechnicalOverview|technical overview]]</nowiki>, Ars Technica's <nowiki>[[http://arstechnica.com/open-source/news/2009/04/the-jackalope-arrives-ubuntu-904-officially-released.ars|Jaunty review]]</nowiki> and Tux Radar's <nowiki>[[http://tuxradar.com/content/road-jaunty-look-back-ubuntus-history|Ubuntu History]]</nowiki> might be interesting.
* Ubuntu distributes software created by <nowiki>[[http://www.x.org|X.org]]</nowiki> video and Linux <nowiki>[[http://wireless.kernel.org|wireless]]</nowiki> networking projects.  Intel video driver users or developers may find this <nowiki>[[http://keithp.com/blogs/Sharpening_the_Intel_Driver_Focus/|blog post]]</nowiki> helpful.
